alert.note: Alert for Daviess (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 1:42PM CDT until March 31 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN DAVIESS...NORTHWESTERN GRUNDY...SOUTHWESTERN MERCER AND SOUTHEASTERN HARRISON COUNTIES... At 142 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Gilman City, or 12 miles north of Gallatin, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Gilman City, Coffey, Jameson, Brimson and Modena. This includes Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 85 and 86. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for north central Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
